text: Reminder: Friendly reminder - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Ideas/ct-p/ideas|submit your ideas to the idea forum> and post the link here with your idea. The votes for a feature help HubSpotters understand the demand. Thank you for all of your awesome ideas and feedback, we are listening and appreciate it.

*UTC-NOW:* Can we get `utcnow` from Phyton `dateime` library?
```import datetime
datetime.datetime.utcnow()
print("2022-02-23 17:40:00.123456")```
Like the `today()` function with timezones. Maybe as `now()`  or `utcnow("America/New_York")` ?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#today>
*Background*: I want to do something like this: <https://www.w3schools.com/howto/howto_js_countdown.asp> with <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#between-times|between_times()>.
I think JS would likely be the better solution here. HS is based on JinJava, not actual Jinja/Python
